title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 28 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 1 Chronicles chapter 28 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 28 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 1 Chronicles Chapter 28.

questions.question: Who did David assemble in Jerusalem according to 1 Chronicles 28:1?
options: Princes of Israel, captains, stewards, officers, mighty men, and valiant men
Only the priests and Levites
The elders of Judah
Foreign ambassadors
questions.correctAnswer: Princes of Israel, captains, stewards, officers, mighty men, and valiant men
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:1 states that David assembled all the princes of Israel, captains, stewards, officers, mighty men, and valiant men unto Jerusalem.

questions.question: What did David originally want to build according to 1 Chronicles 28:2?
options: A house of rest for the ark of the covenant
A palace for himself
A fortress around Jerusalem
A temple for Baal
questions.correctAnswer: A house of rest for the ark of the covenant
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:2 says David had in his heart to build a house of rest for the ark of the covenant of the LORD.

questions.question: Why was David told he could not build the house for God's name according to 1 Chronicles 28:3?
options: Because he was a man of war and had shed blood
Because he was too old
Because he lacked resources
Because Solomon was already building it
questions.correctAnswer: Because he was a man of war and had shed blood
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:3 explains that God said David could not build the house because he was a man of war who had shed blood.

questions.question: Who did the LORD choose to sit on the throne of Israel according to 1 Chronicles 28:5?
options: Solomon, David's son
Absalom, David's son
Joab, the captain
Nathan, the prophet
questions.correctAnswer: Solomon, David's son
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:5 states that of all David's sons, the LORD chose Solomon to sit upon the throne of the kingdom of the LORD over Israel.

questions.question: What was Solomon's task according to 1 Chronicles 28:6?
options: To build the house and courts of the LORD
To lead the army into battle
To become a priest
To write the Psalms
questions.correctAnswer: To build the house and courts of the LORD
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:6 says God chose Solomon to build His house and courts.

questions.question: What condition is given in 1 Chronicles 28:7 for Solomon's kingdom to be established forever?
options: If he is constant to do God's commandments and judgments
If he conquers all surrounding nations
If he builds many cities
If he marries into a royal family
questions.correctAnswer: If he is constant to do God's commandments and judgments
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:7 states Solomon's kingdom will be established forever if he remains faithful to God's commandments and judgments.

questions.question: What did David urge all Israel to do in 1 Chronicles 28:8?
options: Keep and seek all the commandments of the LORD
Build a wall around Jerusalem
Offer sacrifices daily
Send tributes to other nations
questions.correctAnswer: Keep and seek all the commandments of the LORD
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:8 instructs Israel to keep and seek the commandments of the LORD to possess the good land.

questions.question: According to 1 Chronicles 28:9, what will happen if Solomon forsakes the LORD?
options: The LORD will cast him off forever
He will be forgiven
He will receive a second chance
Nothing will happen
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD will cast him off forever
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:9 warns that if Solomon forsakes the LORD, He will cast him off forever.

questions.question: What did David give to Solomon according to 1 Chronicles 28:11?
options: The pattern of the porch, houses, treasuries, and the place of the mercy seat
The royal scepter and crown
A fleet of ships
A large army
questions.correctAnswer: The pattern of the porch, houses, treasuries, and the place of the mercy seat
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:11 explains David gave Solomon the detailed pattern for the temple structures including the porch and mercy seat.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Chronicles 28:13, David gave the pattern for the courses of priests and Levites and all service of the house of the LORD.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:13 states David gave the pattern for the priests, Levites, and all the service in the house of the LORD.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Chronicles 28:20 encourages Solomon to fear and be dismayed while building the house of the LORD.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:20 tells Solomon to be strong, courageous, and not fear or be dismayed because God will be with him.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Chronicles 28:21, princes and all the people will be under Solomon's command during the building of the house of God.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:21 states that princes and all the people will be wholly at Solomon's command for the work.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'And the LORD searcheth all _______, and understandeth all the imaginations of the thoughts.' (1 Chronicles 28:9)
options: hearts
minds
spirits
souls
questions.correctAnswer: hearts
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:9 specifically says the LORD searches all hearts and understands imaginations of thoughts.

questions.question: According to 1 Chronicles 28:14, what did David give by weight for all instruments of service?
options: Gold and silver
Bronze and iron
Wood and stone
Copper and tin
questions.correctAnswer: Gold and silver
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:14 states David gave gold and silver by weight for all manner of instruments of service in the house of the LORD.

questions.question: Who did David say would be with Solomon to help in all manner of workmanship according to 1 Chronicles 28:21?
options: The courses of priests, Levites, and all willing skillful men
Only the priests
Only the Levites
Foreign craftsmen
questions.correctAnswer: The courses of priests, Levites, and all willing skillful men
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:21 states that priests, Levites, and all willing skillful men would be with Solomon for all manner of service.

medium.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 28 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 1 Chronicles Chapter 28 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with fear about taking on a difficult task for God. Based on 1 Chronicles 28, what biblical truth would you share to encourage them?
options: Be strong and courageous, for God will not fail nor forsake you.
Avoid the task if it seems too hard.
Rely only on your own strength to succeed.
Wait for others to do the work first.
questions.correctAnswer: Be strong and courageous, for God will not fail nor forsake you.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:20 encourages strength and courage, assuring that God will be with you and will not fail or forsake you. This teaches trust in God's presence and faithfulness during challenging tasks.

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 28 teach about obedience and faithfulness in leadership roles within the church?
options: Leaders must do God's commandments to establish their kingdom forever.
Leaders should seek personal gain above God's commands.
Leadership is based on popularity, not obedience.
Faithfulness is optional for leaders.
questions.correctAnswer: Leaders must do God's commandments to establish their kingdom forever.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:7 shows that Solomon’s kingdom would be established forever if he remained constant in obeying God’s commandments and judgments, highlighting the importance of obedience in leadership.

questions.question: A parent wants to teach their child about serving God wholeheartedly. What wisdom from 1 Chronicles 28 would you share?
options: Serve God with a perfect heart and a willing mind.
Serve only when convenient.
Serve for personal recognition.
Serve God only when others are watching.
questions.correctAnswer: Serve God with a perfect heart and a willing mind.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:9 instructs Solomon to serve God with a perfect heart and willing mind, emphasizing sincerity and wholehearted devotion in service to God.

questions.question: What does 1 Chronicles 28 teach about preparation and planning for God’s work?
options: God’s work requires detailed plans and patterns given by the Spirit.
Preparation is unnecessary; just start immediately.
Plans should be kept secret from others.
Planning is only for worldly projects.
questions.correctAnswer: God’s work requires detailed plans and patterns given by the Spirit.
questions.explanation: Verses 11-19 describe how David gave Solomon detailed plans and patterns for building the temple, showing that careful preparation and divine guidance are essential for God’s work.

questions.question: Based on 1 Chronicles 28, what is the role of community and cooperation in accomplishing God’s work?
options: Many skilled and willing people, including priests, Levites, and princes, support the work under leadership.
One person should do all the work alone.
Only the king is responsible for God’s work.
Community involvement is optional.
questions.correctAnswer: Many skilled and willing people, including priests, Levites, and princes, support the work under leadership.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:21 highlights that priests, Levites, skilled workers, princes, and the people all work together under Solomon’s command, showing the importance of community and cooperation.

questions.question: True or False: David was allowed by God to build the temple because of his faithful obedience.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:3 explains God told David he would not build the temple because he was a man of war who had shed blood, showing that obedience includes accepting God’s specific will.

questions.question: True or False: The LORD chose Solomon to build the house of God and promised to be his Father if Solomon obeyed Him.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verses 6 and 7 clearly state that God chose Solomon to build the house and promised to be his Father, establishing His kingdom if Solomon obeyed His commandments.

questions.question: When facing temptation to forsake God, what encouragement does 1 Chronicles 28 offer?
options: If you seek God, He will be found; but if you forsake Him, He will cast you off forever.
God will always forgive without conditions.
Forsaking God has no consequences.
Temptation is to be ignored, not resisted.
questions.correctAnswer: If you seek God, He will be found; but if you forsake Him, He will cast you off forever.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:9 teaches that God searches all hearts and will be found by those who seek Him, but will reject those who forsake Him, emphasizing faithfulness and accountability.

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 28 illustrate the importance of integrity and honesty in stewardship?
options: David entrusted Solomon with detailed, God-given plans and resources for the temple’s service.
Stewardship is unimportant and can be ignored.
Resources should be hidden from others.
Stewardship is only for personal gain.
questions.correctAnswer: David entrusted Solomon with detailed, God-given plans and resources for the temple’s service.
questions.explanation: Verses 11-19 show David’s honest and transparent stewardship by giving Solomon the plans and resources to build the temple, highlighting integrity in managing God's gifts.

questions.question: A believer is wondering about God’s faithfulness in their daily work. What teaching from 1 Chronicles 28 would you share?
options: God promises to not fail or forsake those who commit to His work.
God only helps in spiritual matters, not daily work.
God’s faithfulness depends on human effort alone.
Faithfulness is not necessary in everyday work.
questions.correctAnswer: God promises to not fail or forsake those who commit to His work.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:20 assures that God will not fail or abandon those engaged in His service, encouraging trust and perseverance in daily responsibilities.

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 28 encourage spiritual discipline and personal devotion?
options: Seek God with a perfect heart and willing mind, for He understands all thoughts.
Devotion can be half-hearted and casual.
Spiritual discipline is optional.
Only public worship matters, not personal devotion.
questions.correctAnswer: Seek God with a perfect heart and willing mind, for He understands all thoughts.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:9 teaches the importance of sincere, wholehearted devotion because the LORD searches hearts and understands thoughts, emphasizing personal spiritual discipline.

questions.question: What does 1 Chronicles 28 teach about the legacy we leave for future generations?
options: Obeying God’s commandments helps us possess the land and leave an inheritance for our children forever.
Our actions have no effect on future generations.
Legacy is built on wealth alone, not obedience.
Future generations will not remember us.
questions.correctAnswer: Obeying God’s commandments helps us possess the land and leave an inheritance for our children forever.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:8 teaches that keeping God’s commandments ensures possession of the land and leaving a lasting inheritance, highlighting stewardship and faithfulness for family.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: David said to Solomon, 'Take heed now; for the LORD hath chosen thee to build an ______ for the sanctuary: be strong, and do it.'
options: house
army
city
temple
questions.correctAnswer: house
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:10 quotes David telling Solomon that the LORD chose him to build a house for the sanctuary, emphasizing the sacred responsibility.

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 28 model the virtue of humility in leadership?
options: David acknowledges God’s choice and plans rather than boasting about his own achievements.
David claims all the credit for the temple plans.
David ignores God’s instructions.
David forces Solomon to build without encouragement.
questions.correctAnswer: David acknowledges God’s choice and plans rather than boasting about his own achievements.
questions.explanation: Throughout the chapter, especially verses 3-6, David recognizes God's sovereign choice and does not boast, demonstrating humility in leadership by submitting to God’s will.

questions.question: According to 1 Chronicles 28, what attitude should one have toward serving in God’s house or church ministry?
options: Be willing and skillful, ready to serve with dedication.
Serve only when convenient or for personal gain.
Serve reluctantly and complain.
Avoid serving others.
questions.correctAnswer: Be willing and skillful, ready to serve with dedication.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:21 emphasizes that willing, skillful men will serve in the house of God, highlighting the importance of dedication and readiness in ministry.

hard.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 28 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 1 Chronicles Chapter 28.

questions.question: Who did David assemble at Jerusalem before addressing them about the temple building?
options: Princes of Israel, captains, stewards, mighty and valiant men
Only the priests and Levites
The foreign ambassadors and merchants
All Israelite women and children
questions.correctAnswer: Princes of Israel, captains, stewards, mighty and valiant men
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:1 states that David assembled all the princes of Israel, captains, stewards, mighty men, and valiant men unto Jerusalem.

questions.question: Why did God forbid David from building the house for His name?
options: Because David was a man of war who shed blood
Because David was too old
Because the people opposed it
Because David lacked resources
questions.correctAnswer: Because David was a man of war who shed blood
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:3 explicitly says God told David he could not build the house because he was a man of war who had shed blood.

questions.question: Which son of David did God choose to build the house and courts of the LORD?
options: Solomon
Absalom
Adonijah
Nathan
questions.correctAnswer: Solomon
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:6 reveals that God chose Solomon to build His house and courts.

questions.question: According to 1 Chronicles 28, what condition is placed on Solomon's kingdom being established forever?
options: If he is constant to do God's commandments and judgments
If he conquers all neighboring nations
If he builds a larger palace than David's
If he marries a foreign princess
questions.correctAnswer: If he is constant to do God's commandments and judgments
questions.explanation: Verse 7 specifies that Solomon's kingdom will be established forever if he remains faithful to God's commandments and judgments.

questions.question: What exhortation does David give to Solomon regarding serving God?
options: Serve God with a perfect heart and willing mind
Serve God only when convenient
Serve God with fear and trembling
Serve God like the priests do
questions.correctAnswer: Serve God with a perfect heart and willing mind
questions.explanation: In 1 Chronicles 28:9, David advises Solomon to serve God with a perfect heart and willing mind because God searches all hearts.

questions.question: What does David give Solomon to guide the building of the temple?
options: The pattern of the porch, houses, treasuries, chambers, and mercy seat
Only verbal instructions
A large sum of gold and silver with no plans
A set of laws to govern temple worship
questions.correctAnswer: The pattern of the porch, houses, treasuries, chambers, and mercy seat
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:11 shows David giving Solomon the detailed pattern for the temple and its furnishings.

questions.question: What type of gold and silver does David specify for temple instruments and vessels?
options: By weight, pure and refined
As much as Solomon can gather
Only gold, no silver
Only silver, no gold
questions.correctAnswer: By weight, pure and refined
questions.explanation: Verses 14-18 describe David giving gold and silver by weight for all temple instruments, including refined gold for the altar of incense.

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'pattern' David received by the Spirit for the temple building?
options: It was divinely inspired and detailed in writing
It was a common architectural plan of the time
It was a verbal tradition passed down
It was a dream David had
questions.correctAnswer: It was divinely inspired and detailed in writing
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:19 states that the LORD made David understand the pattern in writing by His hand upon him, indicating divine inspiration.

questions.question: What encouragement does David give Solomon regarding fear and courage in building the temple?
options: Be strong and of good courage; fear not nor be dismayed
Seek help from foreign craftsmen
Wait until the people agree
Build slowly and cautiously
questions.correctAnswer: Be strong and of good courage; fear not nor be dismayed
questions.explanation: Verse 20 records David encouraging Solomon to be strong and courageous without fear, because God will be with him.

questions.question: Who will assist Solomon in all the work of the temple service according to David?
options: Priests, Levites, willing skilful men, princes, and all the people
Only the priests
Foreign laborers and merchants
Solomon must work alone
questions.correctAnswer: Priests, Levites, willing skilful men, princes, and all the people
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:21 states that priests, Levites, skilful men, princes, and the people will be at Solomon’s command for the temple work.

questions.question: True or False: David’s plan to build the temple was fulfilled by himself since he had prepared everything.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: David was not allowed to build the temple because he was a man of war; instead, Solomon, his son, was chosen to build it (1 Chronicles 28:3, 6).

questions.question: Which of the following best represents the typological significance of Solomon’s temple building commission in 1 Chronicles 28?
options: Foreshadowing Christ as the ultimate builder of God’s spiritual house
A political attempt to unify Israel under one king
A purely architectural achievement with no spiritual meaning
An act of rebellion against God’s will
questions.correctAnswer: Foreshadowing Christ as the ultimate builder of God’s spiritual house
questions.explanation: Solomon’s building of the temple prefigures the New Testament theme where Christ is the cornerstone and builder of God’s spiritual house (Ephesians 2:20-22), relating to the divine plan mentioned in 1 Chronicles 28.

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 28 emphasize the importance of heart attitude in serving God?
options: God searches all hearts and imaginations, requiring perfect and willing service
External rituals alone are sufficient
Service is only about physical strength and skill
The heart is irrelevant if one follows the law
questions.correctAnswer: God searches all hearts and imaginations, requiring perfect and willing service
questions.explanation: Verse 9 highlights that the LORD searches hearts and imaginations, and Solomon must serve with a perfect heart and willing mind.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: David said to Solomon, 'Fear not, nor be dismayed: for the LORD God, even my God, will be with thee; he will not _____ thee, nor forsake thee.'
options: fail
judge
ignore
rebuke
questions.correctAnswer: fail
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:20 states that God will not fail or forsake Solomon, encouraging courage.

questions.question: What literary device is prominently used in David’s address to Solomon regarding the temple building and God’s commandments?
options: Chiasm, emphasizing obedience and divine promise
Allegory relating to Egypt
Parable about kingship
Hyperbole about wealth
questions.correctAnswer: Chiasm, emphasizing obedience and divine promise
questions.explanation: David’s speech uses chiasm by balancing admonitions to obey God with promises of kingdom establishment (1 Chronicles 28:6-7, 9).

theological.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 28 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 1 Chronicles Chapter 28 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 1 Chronicles 28, why was David forbidden by God to build the house for His name?
options: Because he was a man of war and had shed blood
Because he was too old to build it
Because he was not chosen by God
Because the temple was meant for Solomon only
questions.correctAnswer: Because he was a man of war and had shed blood
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:3 states that God forbade David to build the house because he was a man of war who shed blood. This reflects God's holiness and the requirement that the temple be built by a man of peace. This connects with other scriptures such as 1 Kings 5:3 where Solomon is commissioned to build the temple, and Hebrews 9:11 which speaks of Christ as the ultimate high priest and temple builder, showing the fulfillment beyond human limitations.

questions.question: Who did God choose to build the house of the LORD according to 1 Chronicles 28?
options: Solomon
David
Nathan
Absalom
questions.correctAnswer: Solomon
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:5-6 reveals that God chose Solomon, David's son, to build the house of the LORD. This choice highlights God's sovereign election and plan in the Davidic line, fulfilled ultimately in Christ, the true temple (John 2:19-21) and the eternal king (Luke 1:32).

questions.question: What condition does God place on Solomon's kingdom being established forever?
options: If he is constant to do God's commandments and judgments
If he builds the temple quickly
If he conquers all enemies
If he makes peace with neighboring nations
questions.correctAnswer: If he is constant to do God's commandments and judgments
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:7 states that Solomon's kingdom will be established forever if he remains faithful to God's commandments and judgments. This teaches the biblical principle of covenant faithfulness (Deuteronomy 7:9), reflecting God's faithfulness and human responsibility, also seen in Jesus Christ's perfect obedience (Hebrews 5:8-9).

questions.question: What does David exhort Solomon to do in 1 Chronicles 28:9?
options: Know the God of your father and serve Him with a perfect heart and willing mind
Build the temple by the next harvest
Gather the people to Jerusalem
Make peace with the Philistines
questions.correctAnswer: Know the God of your father and serve Him with a perfect heart and willing mind
questions.explanation: David instructs Solomon in 1 Chronicles 28:9 to know God intimately and serve Him wholeheartedly. This emphasizes the necessity of sincere worship and devotion (Psalm 119:2), reflecting the heart-oriented worship God desires (John 4:23-24) and the search for God with a pure heart as in Jeremiah 29:13.

questions.question: What assurance does David give Solomon about God's presence in the work of building the house?
options: The LORD God will be with thee; He will not fail thee nor forsake thee
The priests will do all the work
You will build it without any opposition
Your kingdom will be without enemies
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD God will be with thee; He will not fail thee nor forsake thee
questions.explanation: In 1 Chronicles 28:20, David encourages Solomon by assuring God's unfailing presence and support. This aligns with God's promises elsewhere such as Joshua 1:5 and Hebrews 13:5, demonstrating God's steadfast faithfulness and covenantal presence with His servants.

questions.question: What role do the priests and Levites have in Solomon's building of the house according to 1 Chronicles 28?
options: They shall be with Solomon for all the service of the house of God
They are to stay in the camp and pray
They shall build the palace instead
They are to remain in their cities
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be with Solomon for all the service of the house of God
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:21 states that priests and Levites will assist Solomon in all the service of the house of God, highlighting the ecclesiastical structure and worship order ordained by God (Numbers 3:5-10, Ezra 3:8). This cooperation illustrates the communal nature of worship and service.

questions.question: What did David give to Solomon as a guide for building the house?
options: The pattern of the porch, houses, treasuries, and inner chambers
A list of workers
A supply of gold and silver only
A letter to the priests
questions.correctAnswer: The pattern of the porch, houses, treasuries, and inner chambers
questions.explanation: According to 1 Chronicles 28:11-12, David provided Solomon with the detailed pattern of the temple's structure and its courts, given by the Spirit of God. This divine blueprint echoes the instructions for the Tabernacle given to Moses (Exodus 25:9) and points to the ordered worship God commands.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: David said, 'Be strong and of good courage, and do it: fear not, nor be dismayed: for the LORD God, even my God, will be with thee; he will not ____ thee, nor ____ thee.'
options: fail, forsake
leave, abandon
ignore, neglect
reject, forget
questions.correctAnswer: fail, forsake
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:20 shows David encouraging Solomon with God's promise not to fail or forsake him. This echoes God's covenantal faithfulness (Deuteronomy 31:6), reassuring believers of God's unchanging nature (Hebrews 13:5).

questions.question: What does 1 Chronicles 28 teach about God's knowledge of human hearts?
options: The LORD searches all hearts and understands all imaginations of thoughts
God only judges outward actions
God is unaware of secret thoughts
Human hearts are hidden from God
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD searches all hearts and understands all imaginations of thoughts
questions.explanation: Verse 9 teaches that God searches the heart and knows our thoughts, highlighting His omniscience (Psalm 44:21, Jeremiah 17:10, Hebrews 4:13). This underscores the biblical doctrine that God judges not only actions but the intents of the heart (1 Samuel 16:7).

questions.question: According to 1 Chronicles 28, what materials did David provide by weight for the temple service?
options: Gold and silver for all instruments and vessels
Only gold for the altar
Iron and bronze for the tools
Precious stones for decoration
questions.correctAnswer: Gold and silver for all instruments and vessels
questions.explanation: Verses 14-18 describe David giving gold and silver by weight for all temple instruments and vessels. This reflects the biblical principle of honoring God with the best resources (Exodus 25:3-7) and prefigures Christ’s precious sacrifice (1 Peter 1:18-19).

questions.question: What does 1 Chronicles 28 reveal about God's father-son relationship with Solomon?
options: God said He would be Solomon’s father and Solomon His son
God rejected Solomon
Solomon was to be a priest instead of a king
Solomon was chosen because he was the eldest
questions.correctAnswer: God said He would be Solomon’s father and Solomon His son
questions.explanation: Verse 6 shows God’s covenantal adoption of Solomon as His son, indicating a special relationship. This foreshadows the Messianic sonship of Christ (Psalm 2:7, Hebrews 1:5) and highlights the divine authority given to Solomon.

questions.question: What is the theological significance of David assembling all Israel’s leaders before instructing Solomon?
options: It demonstrates communal responsibility in God's covenant purposes
It was purely a political gathering
It was to announce war plans
It was to collect taxes
questions.correctAnswer: It demonstrates communal responsibility in God's covenant purposes
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 28:1 shows David gathering all leaders, signifying that temple worship and obedience are corporate duties, emphasizing ecclesiology and the covenant community (Deuteronomy 29:10-15, Acts 2:42-47).

questions.question: According to 1 Chronicles 28, what is the purpose of keeping and seeking all the commandments of the LORD?
options: To possess the good land and leave it as an inheritance forever
To gain wealth and power
To avoid military defeat
To receive praise from the people
questions.correctAnswer: To possess the good land and leave it as an inheritance forever
questions.explanation: Verse 8 links obedience to God's commandments with possession of the land and a lasting inheritance, reflecting the covenant promise to Israel (Deuteronomy 11:8-9) and the spiritual inheritance offered by God to His people (Ephesians 1:11-14).

questions.question: What does 1 Chronicles 28:19 reveal about how David received the temple plans?
options: The LORD made him understand in writing by His hand upon him
He dreamed the plans himself
He copied plans from Solomon
He received them by consulting the priests
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD made him understand in writing by His hand upon him
questions.explanation: This verse emphasizes divine revelation and inspiration in the temple plans, affirming God's sovereign guidance (Exodus 31:3-5, Jeremiah 30:2, 2 Timothy 3:16), highlighting the Scriptures' divine origin.

questions.question: What does 1 Chronicles 28 teach about human strength and courage in God's service?
options: Be strong and do it; fear not and be not dismayed because God is with you
Wait until you feel strong
Rely only on human wisdom
Avoid challenges to stay safe
questions.correctAnswer: Be strong and do it; fear not and be not dismayed because God is with you
questions.explanation: Verses 10 and 20 command strength and courage with the assurance of God's presence. This correlates with biblical calls to courage in leadership (Joshua 1:9), reliance on God’s power (2 Timothy 1:7), and overcoming fear by faith (Isaiah 41:10).
